summary: This is a court order by Judge Alison J. Nathan denying Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for release on bail. The order states that the court finds Maxwell poses a flight risk and that no conditions of release can reasonably assure her appearance at future proceedings. The court is temporarily sealing a detailed opinion to allow parties to propose redactions.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case who filed a renewed motion for release on bail, which was denied by the court.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge who issued the order denying Maxwell's bail motion and presided over the initial bail hearing.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over Maxwell's criminal case and ruled on her bail motion.

events.title: Initial Bail Hearing
events.description: The court conducted an extensive bail hearing and determined that pre-trial detention was warranted for Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Maxwell Files Renewed Bail Motion
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell filed a renewed motion for release on bail (Dkt No. 97).

events.title: Court Denies Bail Motion
events.description: Judge Nathan issued an order denying Maxwell's renewed bail motion, finding she remains a flight risk.

keyFacts: Judge Alison J. Nathan denied Ghislaine Maxwell's renewed motion for release on bail on December 28, 2020.
The court found that Maxwell poses a flight risk and that no conditions of release could reasonably assure her appearance at future proceedings.
The initial bail hearing was held on July 14, 2020, where pre-trial detention was first determined to be warranted.
The court is temporarily sealing a detailed opinion to allow parties to propose redactions before public filing.
The Government does not contend that Maxwell poses a danger to the community, but the court found other factors warranted detention.
